sentence.text: lipid biosynthetic process phosphorylates purine nucleobase metabolic process/2, converts PRPS1/2 hexamers to monomers, and inhibits PRPS1/2 activity and subsequent nucleotide and NAD synthesis to maintain tumor cell growth and survival.

Knock-in of nonphosphorylatable purine nucleobase metabolic process/2 mutants, which have uninhibited activity, in brain tumor cells under energy stress exhausts cellular ATP and NADPH and increases reactive oxygen species levels, thereby promoting cell apoptosis.
